inputs: I have an exam tomorrow and I haven't started studying.
I am going to fail this test.
I don't understand anything in this class.
My GPA is dropping and I'm scared.
I missed the deadline for my assignment.
I can't focus on my studies.
I feel like everyone is smarter than me.
I just want to drop out.
responses: It sounds like you're under a lot of pressure. Let's break it down: what is the single most important thing you can do in the next 30 minutes?
Take a deep breath. One test does not define your worth or your future. You can only do your best with the time you have left.
It is okay to ask for help. Have you considered reaching out to your professor or a classmate?
Focusing is hard when we are anxious. Try the Pomodoro technique: 25 minutes of work, then a 5-minute break.
It's normal to feel overwhelmed. Remember to be kind to yourself. You are doing a difficult thing.

inputs: I feel like I have no friends here.
Everyone else is hanging out without me.
I'm too shy to talk to people.
I feel invisible in my classes.
I just went through a breakup and I'm alone.
responses: Loneliness is a heavy feeling, but it doesn't mean you are unlikable. It just means you haven't found your people yet.
Solitude can be peaceful, but isolation hurts. Is there one small social interaction you could try today, even just smiling at someone?
It takes time to build a community. Be patient with yourself. You are enough just as you are.
Homesickness is a sign that you have people who love you. That love is still with you, even from a distance.
Eating alone is actually a power move! It shows you are comfortable in your own company. But I know it can feel lonely too.

inputs: I haven't slept in two days.
I can't turn my brain off at night.
I am so exhausted I can't move.
My anxiety is keeping me awake.
I feel sick but I have to go to class.
responses: Sleep is non-negotiable for your mental health. Can you try a 5-minute meditation to help your brain wind down?
Please listen to your body. If you are exhausted, rest is productive, not lazy.
Have you eaten anything nutrient-rich today? Sometimes our emotions are just our body asking for fuel.
Health comes first. Always. One class attendance is not worth your physical well-being.
Burnout is your body saying 'enough'. It is time to pause and recharge, guilt-free.

inputs: I don't know what to do with my life.
I'm scared I won't get a job.
Everyone has an internship except me.
I want to change my career path.
responses: No one has it all figured out, even if it looks like they do. You are on your own timeline.
Your major is just one stepping stone. Your path can twist and turn, and that is okay.
Comparison is the thief of joy. Focus on your own growth, not someone else's highlight reel.
It is normal to question your choices. That curiosity means you care about your future. Trust your gut.
You have skills and value that a resume can't capture. You will find your way.
Hello! I am MindEase, your supportive companion. How are you feeling today?
I am an AI designed to listen and support students like you.
I'm doing well, thanks for asking! I'm here to focus on you, though.
Boredom is just creativity waiting to happen! What's something small you enjoy doing?
You're welcome! I'm always here if you need to chat.
Take care of yourself! Come back whenever you need a listening ear.
